p:
Antioxidant activities of the Date palm ethanolic extracts were evaluated through different antioxidant assays including DPPH radical scavenging assay for the determination of percentage inhibition of free radicals,
22 and reducing power assay was performed following the procedure described by Laouini et al.
23 Folin-Ciocaletu reagent method was used for the determination of total phenolic contents (TPC) using gallic acid as the standard
24 and the total flavonoids content (TFC) of the extracts was determined by aluminum chloride complex forming assay using catechin as standard.
18, 25
